Salty Blueberry + Ginger Margarita Recipe | Bon Appétit

Made with Cointreau, muddled blueberry, ginger simple syrup, and blanco tequila. By CointreauMay 13, 20213.3(9)Read ReviewsTriangleEmailPinterestPrintEmailPinterestPrintEmailPinterestPrintIngredients1" piece ginger½cup sugar½cup water2Heaping Tbsp Fresh Blueberries1oz. Cointreau2oz. Blanco TequilaCoarse Kosher SaltIceCrystalized ginger (for garnish)PreparationStep 1Smash ginger with the side of your knife to expose the flesh and add it to a small heat proof container with 1/2 cup sugar. Pour 1/2 cup boiling water over the sugar and ginger, fasten a lid on the jar, and shake until the sugar is dissolved. Let it sit until cool. (Keep it in the fridge and use any extra in tea for a gingery kick or for more cocktails!)Step 2To a cocktail shaker add all of your blueberries and a pinch of salt. Muddle until the blueberries turn into a yummy mush.Step 3To your cocktail shaker add Cointreau, tequila, 1 oz. ginger simple syrup and lots of ice! You should fill your shaker up about 3/4 of the way.Step 4Shake your drink until the outside of the shaker is frosty and it's uncomfortable to hold the shaker, about 30 seconds.Step 5Take a paper towel and dip it into your leftover simple syrup. Swipe it around 1/4 of the rim of your glass, and then dip the now-wet side of your glass in salt.Step 6Add ice to the glass and strain your cocktail. Finish with a piece of crystalized ginger and enjoy!How would you rate Salty Blueberry \+ Ginger Margarita ?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (1)Back to TopTriangle4 stars. 
Pretty good, but I added 1 more tablespoon of blueberries, double the ginger (or steep it in the simple syrup overnight) and squeeze of 1/8 of fresh lime to brighten it up.
